text: so the most secure way
to do two-factor authentication is to
use what's called
a security key a security key
is a piece of tamper's hardware
which you have to either plug in
to your to your laptop or your mobile
phone or many mobile phones have uh
you know secure enclaves and whatnot on
it that
can be used to generate you know the
appropriate
you know two-factor authentication
information but
the idea there is that in order to log
in you provide your username and your
password
and what a website checks for
is the ability for
your security key whether it be
something like a yubico yuba key
or whether it be your your mobile phone
to generate the two-factor code
but not in a form field that you have to
manually enter
and that is a non-fishable
form of defense against fishing and if
you look at that that particular
set of security key technology when
google deployed that i believe in 2017
or 2018 i can't remember exactly which
it was but

tens of thousands of employees
and when they looked at it the next year
there were
absolutely no efficient attacks
